Our services include: Resource Efficiency Management (REM), Metering Services, Energy Audit Services, Energy Planning and Strategy, Risk Management, Use of Alternative and Renewable Energy Sources and other services. Our expertise has enabled SEA to capitalize on the shift to energy resource management awareness. Position Description This position requires a highly motived individual who enjoys working in a multi-faceted environment. This position will require team skills, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate should also have a strong sense of personal drive, a desire to develop expertise, and the ability to work without constant supervision. This position will also be expected to identify and manage asset reliability risks that could adversely affect plant or business operations and provide technical support and troubleshooting advice to Engineering, Maintenance & Manufacturing. What You Will Do In Your Role Loss Elimination One of the fundamental roles of the Reliability Engineer is to track the production losses and abnormally high maintenance cost assets, then find ways to reduce those losses or high costs. These losses are prioritized to focus efforts on the largest/most critical opportunities. The Reliability Engineer (in full partnership with the operations team) develops a plan to eliminate or reduce the losses through root cause analysis, obtains approval of the plan and facilitates the implementation. Risk Management Another role of the Reliability Engineer is to manage risk to the achievement of an organization’s strategic objectives in the areas of environmental health and safety, asset capability/Reliability, quality, and production. Some tools used by a Reliability Engineer to identify and reduce risk include: PHA - Preliminary hazards analysis • FMEA - Failure modes and effects analysis • CA - Criticality analysis • SFMEA - Simplified failure modes and effects analysis • MI - Maintainability information • FTA - Fault tree analysis o Participate and lead Break down analysis to identify root causes of complex and/or repetitive problems and put in place executable corrective actions. Life Cycle Asset Management Studies show that as much as 95% of the Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) or Life Cycle Cost (LCC) of an asset is determined before it is put into use. This reveals the need for the Reliability Engineer to be involved in the design and installation stages of projects for new assets and modification of existing assets. Reliability Engineer Responsibilities Works with Engineering & Maintenance functions to ensure the reliability and maintainability of existing, new and modified installations. The Reliability Engineer is responsible for adhering to the Life Cycle Asset Management (LCAM) process throughout the entire life cycle of new assets. Integrates best maintenance technologies into predictive, preventive, and condition-based maintenance programs. Develop, implement, and support preventative and predictive maintenance strategies for new and existing equipment (vibration analysis, lubrication program, oil analysis, ultrasonic, infrared, thermography, and precision maintenance) Participates in the development of design and installation specifications along with commissioning & qualification plans. Participates in the development of criteria for and evaluation of equipment and technical Maintenance, Repair & Operations (MRO) suppliers and technical maintenance service providers. Develops acceptance tests and inspection criteria. Guides efforts to ensure reliability and maintainability of equipment, processes, utilities, facilities, controls, and safety/security systems. Is an expert at Failure Mode Effect Criticality Analysis (FMECA/FMEA) • Professionally and systematically defines, designs, develops, monitors, and refines an Asset Maintenance Plan that includes: o Value-added preventive maintenance tasks based on developed criticality of the assets. o Effective utilization of predictive and other non-destructive testing methodologies designed to identify and isolate inherent reliability problems. Provides input to a Risk Management Plan that will anticipate reliability-related, and non-reliability-related risks that could adversely impact plant operation. Develops engineering solutions to repetitive failures and all other problems that adversely affect plant operations. These problems include capacity, quality, cost, or regulatory compliance issues. To fulfill this responsibility the Reliability Engineer applies: Analyze operational data (KMI, KPIs, KAI’s) to identify gaps and areas of potential improvement o Data analysis techniques that can include: o Statistical Process Control o Reliability modeling and prediction o Fault Tree Analysis Provides engineering support to Maintenance, Operations and Continuous Improvement of the existing systems and processes (troubleshooting, problem solving, cost estimating and implementation of mechanical design solutions) Qualifications/Experience Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university 3.0 GPA or higher. Preferably Mechanical Engineering. 5 or more years of leading production maintenance organization delivering strong results. Must have demonstrated skills in Leadership & Technical skills in leading & transforming the organization/operation. Excellent project management skills. PMP certification is a plus. Well versed with CMMS structure, Problem solving tools (FTA, FMECA, RCA) Familiar with AutoCad/Solid Works systems. knowledge of best sourcing practices; demonstrated influencing skills; excellent organization and follow-up skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, excellent problem-solving skills, ability to organize and prioritize work assignments. Ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Ability to analyze situations and respond in a timely manner. Ability to participate in multi-functional teams. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships within the Barr organization. Possesses service mindset. A visionary. Ability to covert vision into objectives, goals, and strategies with supporting measures for the organization Job Type: Full-time Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Retirement plan Vision insurance Experience level: 10 years 5 years 6 years 7 years 8 years 9 years Schedule: 8 hour shift Work setting: In-person Ability to commute/relocate: Memphis, TN 38113: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Work Location: In person Show Less Report

Job Title: Radar / EW Systems Field Engineering Technician (Tonopah NV)
Job Description: Radar / Electronic Warfare (EW) Systems Field Engineering Technician Location: Tonopah NV Signing Bonus: Yes Remote Living Allowance: Yes Relocation Assistance: Yes Education Reimbursement: Yes US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes Clearance Type: Must be capable of achieving a U.S. DoD SECRET clearance within six months of employment. Active DoD SECRET clearance preferred. (A U.S. security clearance that has been active in the past 24 months is considered active.) Travel: Yes Veterans: CEA Technologies, Inc. is a veteran- & military-friendly company who values your proven leadership skills, mission-focused approach to work, self-discipline, experience working in diverse teams & organizations, extensive training, selfless commitment, adaptability, can-do attitude & strong work ethic. Apply if you are a qualified veteran or military in transition to civilian life. Company Profile CEA Technologies Pty Limited, headquartered in Canberra, Australia, was established in 1983 with a goal of creating a center of excellence for the design & support of advanced electronic systems for the Australian Defence Force. From the outset, CEA Technologies was based on the provision of uncompromising design principles & robust through-life system support. CEA Technologies, Inc, is the U.S. subsidiary focused on support of these delivered systems to the U.S. Defense Community. The primary product is Active Electronically Scanned Array (AESA) radar systems with world-class Digital Beamforming capabilities. Job Description CEA Technologies, Inc. is seeking highly skilled Radar / Electronic Warfare (EW) Systems Field Engineering Technicians (Mid- & Senior-level) to provide operation & sustainment support to a system of radar threat emulators being integrated into the Nevada Test & Training Range. CEA Technologies specializes in state-of-the-art element-level Digital Beam Formed (DBF) Active Electronically Scanned Array (AESA) radar, communications & missile illumination systems for land & maritime environments. The successful candidates will initially spend 60-90 days training & orientation traveling between various locations within the Nevada Test & Training Range, Ridgecrest CA & Point Mugu CA (Naval Air Warfare Center Weapons Division), Valparaiso FL (Eglin Air Force Base) & Fairbanks AK (Joint Pacific Alaskan Radar Complex). After completion, this will be complemented potentially in 2023 by extensive on-the-job training at our parent company's facility in Canberra, Australia for approximately 3-6 weeks to become knowledgeable of all aspects required to support these unique CEA systems. If/when needed, the individual may be deployed to other U.S. ranges to support customer requirements. Responsibilities / tasks include: 1. Perform complex maintenance on all aspects of the radars covering various digital, RF, power & cooling hardware utilizing commercial manuals, OEM supplied documentation to include drawings / schematics & computer-based diagnostic tools. Maintenance activities will include: · Planned maintenance (inspections, servicing, calibration) · Corrective maintenance (troubleshooting, fault detection / isolation, screening, repair) 2. Support the operation of the radars on various DoD test ranges including: · Setup / teardown & performing serviceability assessment · Support during remote field deployment & troubleshooting software & hardware anomalies · Waveform validation · Limited on-site corrective maintenance · Diagnosing malfunctions & replacing components · Detailed inspection, record keeping & administration · Operate & maintain radar systems & associated power / cooling peripheral equipment · Assist with training US government / range contractor personnel 3. Willingness & agility to perform duties outside of core responsibilities to support mission operations 4. Assist in performing logistics support tasks to include logistics planning, supply support, packaging/handling/storage/transportation, personnel & training, facilities & data 5. Document your work in a timely & accurate manner according to the processes, standards & confidentiality guidelines 6. Understand & comply with Safety, Security, Export, Information Technology rules & guidelines 7. Work in remote work areas, indoors & outdoors, at elevated heights (~20 feet) & in confined spaces 8. Lift up to 50 pounds 9. Ensure a professional, proactive & customer-oriented approach to the support of the radar systems 10. Communicate & maintain a quality management plan including conformance & continuous improvement initiatives 11. Other duties as assigned Basic Qualifications: 1. Five years minimum (Mid-level) & ten years minimum (Senior-level) demonstrated experience in the operation & / or sustainment of complex military electronic systems – ideally radar & EW systems 2. Supervisory experience (Senior-level) 3. Possess technical & interpersonal skills necessary to perform in a tightly integrated team of engineers, technicians & logisticians as well as independently in the field 4. Associate’s degree in a relevant technical discipline (e.g., electronics, RF communications, etc.) 5. Prior field experience 6. Ability to adapt to a changing environment & handle multiple priorities 7. Eager to apply your technical skills to learn new radar system operational concepts & apply that knowledge in the field 8. Willingness & ability to work in varying weather conditions 9. Must be capable of achieving a U.S. DoD SECRET clearance within six months of employment. Active DoD SECRET clearance preferred. 10. Knowledge of & experience maintaining electrical, electronic, environmental, hydraulic & mechanical principles relating to radar & EW systems 11. Must be willing & able (on potentially short-notice) to deploy/travel to a variety of domestic locations & for a variety of deployment durations to meet customer needs Desirable Qualifications: 1. Active DoD SECRET clearance 2. Knowledge of & experience maintaining electrical, environmental, hydraulic & mechanical subsystems relating to radar & EW systems 3. Excellent communicator, both written & oral 4. Project Management experience 5. Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft applications – Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint Job Type: Full-time Pay: $34.00 - $38.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Employee assistance program Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Relocation assistance Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Schedule: 10 hour shift Monday to Friday Supplemental pay types: Signing bonus Application Question(s): Are you willing to undergo a background investigation? How many years of demonstrated electronic & mechanical experience do you have? How many years of proven supervisory experience do you have (e.g., leading teams, implementing plans, communicating well with diverse groups)? Education: Associate (Preferred) Security clearance: Secret (Preferred) Work Location: One location Show Less Report

About Linde: Linde is a leading global industrial gases and engineering company with 2020 sales of $27 billion. We live our mission of making our world more productive every day by providing high-quality solutions, technologies and services which are making our customers more successful and helping to sustain and protect our planet. The company serves a variety of end markets including aerospace, chemicals, food and beverage, electronics, energy, healthcare, manufacturing and primary metals. Linde's industrial gases are used in countless applications, from life-saving oxygen for hospitals to high-purity & specialty gases for electronics manufacturing, hydrogen for clean fuels and much more. Linde also delivers state-of-the-art gas processing solutions to support customer expansion, efficiency improvements and emissions reductions. For more information about the company and its products and services, please visit www.linde.com. Job Overview: We are currently seeking a Mechanical and Rotating Equipment Maintenance Engineer to be based at our Hillsboro, OR location and will have a Regional support responsibility. This position will report to the Region Reliability Center Manager. The Maintenance Engineer ensures safe and reliable operation of mechanical systems for Praxair’s facilities at the lowest life cycle cost. This role will be responsible for ensuring Praxair’s maintenance and reliability program is executed in a safe, efficient, and high-quality manner. The successful candidate will also be expected to identify, develop, and implement of innovative solutions to mechanical system/asset issues. This person will also be expected to respond to unplanned events, work independently, and make technical decisions and recommendations. Primary responsibilities: Primary technical resource for maintenance ofRotating equipment such as compressors, turbines, blowers, pumps and associated gearbox and gearing systems. Fixed equipment such as heat exchangers, coolers and cold boxes. Auxiliary systems such as chillers, cooling towers and water treatment systems. Lead predictive maintenance programs - such as vibration analysis and oil analysis - and ensure timely resolution of all identified issues. Lead or assist in Root Cause Analysis (RCA) activities as needed. Identify and resolve chronic mechanical asset concerns (bad actors) Develop and execute small (<$100k) expense/capital projects for reliability improvement. Assist in resolution planning for long-term mechanical asset concerns (reliability threats). Assess equipment performance data and identify and lead activities to ensure optimal reliability and efficient performance. Assist in cost estimation of corrective-maintenance, preventive-maintenance and/or projects. Assist in turnaround planning and execution. Utilize Six Sigma methodologies for continuous improvement of Reliability. Lead resolution of highest impact issues with a strong sense of urgency and integrity. This position requires a combination of office work and field work. This position typically requires approximately 20%-30% travel domestically. They will provide plant engineering technical support in the day-to-day operations of the Peoria Corn Processing Plant. Essential Job Functions Develop an understanding of various plant processes. and monitors status of projects to achieve targeted outcomes. Other duties as assigned. Minimum Job Requirements Commitment to working safely, maintaining environmental compliance, and producing skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent computer skills. Demonstrated problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Ability to effectively work with employees at all levels in the organization. Able to understand and comply with plant GMP and personnel practice requirements. Education Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Synonymous with quality and innovation, thousands of our products have been manufactured and distributed around the world making Explore Industries a thriving powerhouse in its field. Explore Industries is seeking a Production Engineer who is a resourceful self-starter and enjoys working within a collaborative team environment, all with the goal to improve efficiencies and product quality within our manufacturing processes. This onsite position is located at our Marion, SC, Production Campus. The Production Engineer will work closely with the Maintenance, Quality, and Operations teams and will be accountable for proposing, developing, and implementing process and quality improvements; reviewing, and establishing new Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs); and drive cost reduction initiatives. Additionally, the Production Engineer will have quality assurance responsibilities of formalizing Quality Control Procedures for the manufacturing processes. The ideal Production Engineer must have a passion for strategic planning, achieving business results, and enjoy building colleague relationships. Additional essential responsibilities of the Production Engineer role include, but are not limited to: Work with management to establish safety procedures, protocols, identify, and address potential workplace hazards. Develop work routings and ensure accuracy with production to include time studies, the identification of efficiencies, and process improvements. Support sales with product design and technical drawings ensuring compliance with manufacturing procedures. Oversee capital projects and new equipment installations. Partner with the team to identify and correct environment, health, and safety concerns. Are you looking to expand your engineering career, your knowledge base of manufacturing, enjoy helping others grow and be involved in process development, all while being a part of an expanding team with an opportunity to have a long-lasting career? This could be a great career for you! Committed to ongoing growth, product and brand development, and team fulfillment across all areas of the business, we invite you to explore the possibilities. Required Qualifications (We would like our talented Production Engineer for this role to have at least these minimum skills & experience) College Degree in Engineering and/or Certification in an Engineering Specialty. 3 plus years of experience in an applicable position (Continuous Improvement Engineer, Process Improvement Engineer, and/or Manufacturing or Operations Engineer). 2 plus years of experience managing large scale production projects (Make to start or make to order processes). Experience within a manufacturing environment. Understanding and experience with mathematical principles. Experience with computer aided design software (CAD) such as AutoCAD, SolidWorks, Solid Edge, Catia, etc. Strong fundamental understanding of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and how to leverage data to drive results. Preferred Skills for our Production Engineer (We would be excited to hear from you if you also have the following experience) Pool industry experience Lean and Six Sigma methodologies. Benefits An opportunity to be part of a collaborative, encouraging environment where your contributions truly make a difference. Generous Paid Time-Off Package Paid Holidays 401k with match Optional Life and Disability Insurance Optional Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Explore Industries offers a compensation package that includes a competitive base salary and excellent, comprehensive benefits offerings. For more information about Explore Industries, to view the full job description, and to apply online, please visit our website at https://exploreindustries.com/our-company/careers/. We look forward to speaking with you soon! We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $77,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Experience level: 3 years Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekend availability Work setting: In-person Ability to commute/relocate: Marion, SC 29571: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Education: Associate (Preferred) Experience: Applicable Engineering: 3 years (Required) Project engineering: 2 years (Required) Manufacturing Environment: 2 years (Required) Computer Aided Design Software: 1 year (Required) Quality control: 1 year (Required) Work Location: In person Show Less Report

Company Profile: TITAN Metal Fabricators, headquartered in Camarillo, California designs and fabricates highly corrosion-resistant process equipment and piping. The company specializes in reactive metals and corrosion-resistant alloys ranging from Titanium, Tantalum, Zirconium, Hastelloy, to High Nickel Alloys and Stainless Steel. TITAN has a global presence with locations in California, Illinois, Texas, China, and India; supporting customers of all sizes, in all markets and industries worldwide. Job Summary: Design Engineer Reporting organizationally to the Director of Engineering, the candidate will join the Engineering group in the design and drafting of heat exchangers, pressure vessels, piping systems, and other custom static equipment. Job Purpose: The position is responsible for the design and drafting of heat exchangers, pressure vessels, piping systems, and other custom static equipment. This position interfaces with external customers and internal departments to develop precise calculations and detailed drawings for fabrication. The ideal candidate will be a motivated problem solver and very detail-oriented engineer who values creating custom equipment and enjoys seeing their designs become reality. Duties/Responsibilities: Perform vessel calculations to meet ASME Section VIII Division 1 or Division 2, TEMA, PED, CRN, API codes as applicable to the individual project. Complete 2D/3D detailed drawings and Bill of Materials for customer approvals and shop fabrication. Interface with customers, project managers, quality control, and production to ensure smooth workflow of each project. Act as the Engineering contact for a given project from concept to shipment. Work cohesively with a small group of skilled engineers to maintain a high level of quality in design and execution. Qualifications & Experience: Basic requirements include some level of Autocad or other 3D software experience & Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook). 2+ years experience in design/calculation/drafting of pressure-containing equipment is preferred. 2+ years experience with ASME Section VIII Division 1 pressure vessel design code is preferred. Experience with Microsoft Projects and/or the scheduling of multiple-assembly fabrication projects would be considered a bonus. Design experience with TEMA, API 650/620, PED, & CRN is ideal. Strong communicator with the ability to effectively translate technical data to non-technical employees. Ability to problem solve. Ability to meet tight deadlines and critical milestone schedules. Education: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline is required. Professional Engineering License is desired/beneficial. Skills and Abilities: Verbal, written, comprehension and interpersonal skills. Organizational and time management skills. Ability and willingness to learn new software/skills. Strong work ethic, enthusiastic and punctual. Compensation: Competitive Annual Base Salary, dependent on experience and qualification. Benefits: Titan provides a full benefit package which includes: 100% of premiums for Medical and Dental Insurance for employee only coverage, and Titan pays a portion of dependent coverage. Life Insurance Short Term Disability 401K retirement plan with 4% annual employer match Paid time off on an accrued basis. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $75,000.00 per year Benefits: COMPANY OVERVIEW: For more than 30 years, Beneficial Insectary, Inc. has been a leader in the production application of beneficial organisms used in biological pest control and integrated pest management programs. We are the largest producer of beneficial insects in North America. In late 2020, BI was acquired by Biobest Group NV (www.biobestgroup.com), one of the largest global players in the biological pest control industry. GENERAL JOB SUMMARY: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining manufacturing machinery and equipment to ensure the highest level of operational efficiency and productivity. software and other specialized software applications (2D & 3D) · Liaise with machine vendors to design new machines & re-order replacement parts for existing machines. · Preparing documentation of critical analysis and providing suggestions for correcting errors · Continuously learning and keeping up-to-date with advances in technology, materials, and manufacturing processes. · Maintain, repair, and clean packaging machines, sieves, racks, trays, and other equipment · Troubleshoot, install, and repair ac/dc motors, starters, relays, and drives · Install and perform diagnostic tests on mechanical systems · Optimize mechanical efficiency daily by adjusting machinery and equipment settings as well as monitoring and correcting as needed · Disassemble/reassemble equipment such as replacement parts necessary to make equipment repairs · Document processes and maintain mechanical service records · Develop and implement mechanical maintenance plans to prevent costly equipment breakdowns · Follow strict adherence to anti-contamination procedures, including movement of people and equipment · Other duties as assigned REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: · Advanced arithmetic & analytical skills · Working knowledge of mechanical diagnostics · Comprehensive reading and legible writing skills to manually record data · Ability to track procedures according to calendars and schedules · Ability to follow verbal and written directions, manuals, processes, and procedures · Ability to follow safety rules in compliance with Cal-OSHA · Working knowledge of proper hand tools and power tools for specific applications · Ability to communicate effectively with co-workers, team leaders, and management QUALIFICATIONS: · Bachelors in Engineering or related field · 5+ years of experience in designing, developing, and maintaining manufacturing machinery and equipment. · Must have valid driver’s license and reliable transportation · Availability to fix The Validation Engineers primary responsibilities will include interpreting & implementing tests & test programs from customer and/or internal quality test specifications. Not directly responsible for budget and resource management. This position strongly consists of validation of electronic & electromechanical switching products for new product validation, manufacturing process verifications, and quality validation. Assume a lead role during test programs and provide management feedback when resources are needed and when problems arise. Assume a pro-active lead role in carrying out testing & testing results. Learn technology behind new and existing products to better understand tests and test methods necessary for each individual product as assigned. Work directly with development / manufacturing / quality. Attend internal meetings as necessary to provide technological feedback and present findings. Support budget process & equipment quoting. Aid in test equipment design & advice from time to time. Backup for Test Lab Manager for technical issues & information dispersal. Responsible for accurate data being published in test reports. Improving test procedures & method for efficiency when they’re repeated. Analyzing & interpreting large amounts of test data. Provide active communications to the Test Lab Manager and Test Lab Technicians Assist in time line development, DVP&R, and EMC/Electrical test plan development This position requires contact and collaboration with other members of the manufacturing, design, quality engineering teams at all levels of the organization including other Marquardt facilities. This position requires proficiency with computing & analyzing methods and excellent computing skills validation. An acceptable substitute would be 2+ years study with 10+ years experience in the same principles. Accredited BS degree or Accredited AS or AAS with credible references for experience. involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Ability to use Microsoft Office Suite, Windows, E-mail, and telephone. Must possess knowledge of schematic entry and ability to read Build Community, Build Your Career with the City of Moorhead! Civil Engineering Technician II This skilled technical position performs intermediate work in field and office of engineering, surveying project sites, performing quantitative research, drafting plans, preparing maps, calculating and recording data and quantities, performing algebraic and geometric design computations, operating survey equipment and utilizes AutoCAD Civil 3D software, performing construction staking on project sites, inspecting construction projects for compliance with plans and specifications, preparing and maintaining records, files and reports, conducting safety and maintenance inspections of City infrastructure, and related work as required. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Develops and prepares preliminary engineering reports, plans and specifications for a wide variety of utility and transportation infrastructure projects, including sewer and water mains and streets for approval by the Senior Engineer. Performs preliminary design calculations for estimating quantities and designing line, grade and alignment of utility and transportation infrastructure projects for approval by the Senior Engineer. Develops, prepares and/or reviews and updates utility and transportation infrastructure maps, database and comprehensive plans. Maintains and preserves public works records; drafts as-built records of projects and infrastructure; documents changes for the operation and maintenance programs such as GIS and AutoCAD. Operates survey equipment including GPS equipment, Total Station equipment, Auto levels, grade rods, etc.; performs construction staking crews and completes as-built surveys using CAD equipment. Performs the following duties on Federal, Municipal, State Aid and locally funded projects: drafts and calculates field notes to document material testing and certification, contractor installed quantities, project alignment and grades at designated locations according to project plans. Additionally, performs construction inspection to ensure compliance with the plans, specifications and applicable Federal and Municipal State Aid project development requirements. **(Eng. Tech I only works on local projects and not federal or state projects) Researches records, maps and other information to obtain typical engineering data such as location of easements, sewer stubs, water mains, hydrants, property special assessments, etc. Drafts detailed dimensional drawings such as street, water, sewer, drainage and other utility plans, systems and projects. Reviews and recommends approval of shop drawings and submittals for compliance with project material specifications. Performs office-related functions including preparing correspondence, maps, presentation materials, brochures, field notes, printing materials, answering phones and responding to inquiries from contractors, developers, property owners, staff and the general public; prepares and maintains records, files and reports as required. Creates charts for statistical data representation; completes finished designs and calculations from sketches. Uses computer assisted drafting (Auto CAD Civil 3D) equipment and software. Engineer Tech II ONLY: Performs other duties as requested. Which may include: Receives, reviews, and approves or denies public right-of-way applications for utility installation/repairs, curb/gutter repairs, driveway approach installation/repairs, and right-of-way restoration work. Inspect and manage the restoration and construction timeline of work, produce notifications and correspondence for the public and GPS and maintain records pertaining to the applied right-of-way construction and restoration. Performs inspections of in service bridges and maintains maps, drawings, plans and inspection reports in accordance with FHWA and MnDOT. Attendance at off-site courses/trainings/seminars may be required. Engineer Technician II - Requirements Associates/Technical degree or higher in civil engineering, engineering technology, surveying, drafting, construction management, or related field Minimum of three years experience in the utilization of current AutoCAD Civil 3D software, performing and assisting in surveying, construction management, construction inspection, or related field MnDOT Certifications (within 12 months of hire) (Aggregate Production: (Grading & Base, 1&2Bituminous Streets 1&2Concrete Field 1&2) Valid driver's license To learn more: www.cityofmoorhead.com/jobs The City of Moorhead offers a positive, friendly and collaborative work environment that is team focused where everyone is working together to serve our community. The City of Moorhead is an equal opportunity employer and a proud employer located in the metropolitan region of Fargo-Moorhead. SC-PAY GRADE 10 ENGINEERING/PLANNING TECHNICIAN I DUTIES AND FEATURES OF THE CLASS: The incumbent in this class performs a variety of skilled and semi-skilled technical tasks involving engineering or planning, reviews and implements area-wide planning studies or performs entry level engineering, inspection and/or surveying. Work is performed both in the field and in the office. The work involves the application of knowledge gained through education and experience. Work is performed under general supervision of the Department Manager/Director or their designee. EXAMPLES OF WORK: Reads and interprets plans, specifications and related documents; copies maps and charts as required; utilizes computer software; provides technical assistance to consulting engineers, developers, coworkers and the general public. Planning: Assists in planning projects and studies and in their implementation; assists in coordinating the extension of sewer and water districts; participates in the organization of an expansion to sanitary sewer districts; reviews sewer concept plans. Engineering: Assists with designs/reviews of engineering projects, alignments, profiles, studies and related documents; compiles and records test results, notes and sketches to document compliance and/or develops designs, specifications, maps and other geographically based data. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: Knowledge of the principles and practices of civil engineering; Working with our local technical team and our corporate technical resources in Denmark, you will be directly responsible for process improvements in all facets of our operations. From multi-million dollar capex projects to simple troubleshooting, you will be our Findlay facility’s leader in continuous improvement. We are a feed additive manufacturer that is a global leader in providing young animal nutrition to our customers. As a company, we have grown significantly, with this facility leading the way in growth over the last ten years. With five line expansions in that time and multiple capex projects every year, you will support our fully automated facility along with our onsite automation team to continue driving downtime lower each year and finding ways to boost output, all while providing the high-quality product our customers rely on. Job Objectives: Safety: Develop, promote and enforce safety in the workplace by actively demanding employees and contractors to work safely by setting and personally demonstrating safe work habits. Work with the facility to prioritize and optimize ‘Key Performance Indicators” (KPI) Provide general technical assistance to operations staff concerning the following: dry material handling, air flows, heat exchange, electricity and power, programmable logistical controllers (PLC), steam generation/use and liquid movement/storage. Collaborate with facility management to define technical needs and Capex requirements, recommend Capex projects, evaluate Capex proposals for technical viability, and lead designated Capex projects. Identify, promote, and coordinate implementation of best practices across the facility and assist with problem-solving and troubleshooting operational problems. Demonstrate cost conscious and quality conscious decision making. Interface effectively with other departments such as commercial, accounting, QA/QC, and procurement to assist with optimal execution of business needs. Assist with review of production data routinely to ensure accuracy and to analyze for continuous improvements throughout the facility. Occasional remote support of continuous improvement efforts at sister facility. Ability to assist in day to day operations as needed. Project design, development and management that are specific to the operations of an operating department. Required Qualifications: - Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering. - 5 years’ experience in process improvement or project management. - Passing a mechanical aptitude test with strong problem-solving skills. - Demonstrates project management and organizational skills. - Strong verbal and written communication skills. - Collaborative team player. Preferred Qualifications: - 2 years’ experience in the feed, food or biochemical industry. - Experience in a highly automated facility, SCADA and/or Rockwell based is ideal. - Experience leading Capex projects. - Experience with root cause analysis techniques. Physical Requirements: - Able to lift and transport up to 50 pounds on an occasional basis. - Requires a full range of physical motion in order to move throughout the facility, including climbing stairs, ladders, and to work at heights. Job environment may be dusty at times. 1-2 weeks of primarily international travel to our corporate office. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Referral program Retirement plan Vision insurance Experience level: 5 years Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday Work setting: In-person Manufacturing facility Ability to commute/relocate: Findlay, OH 45840: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Work Location: One location Show Less Report

of temporary or permanent system fixes as a corrective action resulting from detailed troubleshooting of faulted/inoperable/disabled/broken toner filling process and control system. Performing review productivity manufacturing environment. Experience maintaining and troubleshooting complex control systems, including software, hardware, wiring, and electro-mechanical components. Experience programming, installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting manufacturing image vision systems such as Cognex and Keyence Strong project leader with excellent organizational and verbal skills. time management, and problem-solving skills including root cause analysis and developing temporary and permanent solutions with a strong attention to detail. Able to manage multiple concurrent tasks Job Title: Hardware Engineering Manager Job Overview: The Hardware Engineering Manager (HWM) is responsible for managing the U.S. and China-based hardware engineering team and customer-facing applications engineers to develop a complete and cost-effective engineering solution to meet customers’ performance and quality requirements. It is a hands-on project engineering role tasked with building, managing, and mentoring the team and with individual contributions to engineering solutions when required. HWM develops an efficient and timely process for assessing, implementing and supporting Unigen’s products, and engineering projects including outsourcing if necessary to meet Unigen’s customer needs. HWM works with product marketing and manufacturing engineering to assess the feasibility of new products and the timely and efficient delivery of finished products. This includes product specification, design approval, component selection, prototyping, modeling, analysis, and testing. Reports to Executive Vice President. Located at the Unigen Headquarters in Newark, CA. Primary Job Responsibilities: 1. Hardware Build an engineering team focused on innovation and new product development Manage a hardware engineering team focused on the development and test of high-speed storage-focused PCB products and solutions Guide and develop the verification team to efficiently focus on product testing and verification tools and procedures Develop and manage a software and firmware team to support Unigen's existing and future products Maintain and apply knowledge of the latest technical developments in PCB and firmware design and test for the storage, data center, and embedded industries 2. JOB SPECIFICATION Quality Engineer COMPANY DESCRIPTION: Steel Partners Holdings L.P. (NYSE: SPLP; www.steelpartners.com) is a publicly-traded diversified global holding company that has significant interests in leading companies in various industries including diversified industrial products, energy, defense, banking, insurance, food products and services, oilfield services, sports, training, education, and the entertainment and lifestyle industries. As long-term investors, Steel Partners has focused on enhancing value through the implementation of operational excellence, corporate strategic restructuring programs and other components of the Steel Partners culture - what we call “The Steel Way.” Together, Steel Partners businesses generate $3.4 billion in revenue and employ more than 13,000 people in 18 countries. To find out more about the company, please visit www.SteelPartners.com. HandyTube Corporation is a seamless specialty tubing manufacturer based in Camden, Delaware. As a premium manufacturer, HandyTube provides customer-specific solutions for the flow of gas, steam, and liquids in the most harsh and demanding environments. The Company’s process allows it to produce made-to-order, seamless, stainless steel and specialty alloy tubing ranging from one inch in diameter to finer than a human hair, and in continuous lengths that can exceed a mile. Dedicated to high-quality service and products. HandyTube’s highly experienced engineers provide expertise on new product development through continuous improvement and lean manufacturing and work successfully with customers globally to take products and projects from initial concept to full scale implementation. Customers rely on the Company’s team of engineers to refine ideas, explore options, create new solutions, analyze values, and deliver on commitments. To find out more about HandyTube, please visit www.handytube.com Position Key to delivering world class products to our customers is the ability to optimize the cost and efficiency of our manufacturing processes. Reporting to the Quality Manager, the Quality Engineer manages complex projects involving new equipment, process improvements, and modifications to existing equipment with an overall goal of improving the quality, capability and capacity of our production lines. Utilizing continuous improvement tools, the Senior Manufacturing Engineer will analyze, plan, and manage projects related to equipment purchases and upgrades, including all stages of project execution from final equipment selection to startup and documentation. The Quality Engineer will provide guidance and technical support to Manufacturing Engineers, Process Engineers, Maintenance Technicians, and Operations Personnel. This position requires strong project management, teamwork, collaboration, and communication skills. The Quality Engineer utilizes prior experience, current research and creativity to develop ideal solutions to manufacturing needs. The Quality Engineer will assist in the planning, development, implementation, communication and maintenance of the company’s quality management systems, polices, documentation, data, and customer-specific requirements. Responsibilities Review and Assess Supplier QMS and Process/Product Development Identify Quality issues via On-Site visits and assessment audits Testing and assessments on product to identify potential or current quality issues Initiate & maintain Documentation and reports as they relate to Supplier Quality with interface with UACJ Quality and Manufacturing Engineering Initiate & maintain communication between suppliers and Quality and Purchasing Management with regularly scheduled meetings Provide technical assistance and guidance to supplier along with designing or specifying inspection and testing mechanisms and equipment; guidance will be in conjunction with plant specific Quality Engineer to ensure customer expectations are understood and met Analyzing production and service limitations and standards Recommending revisions of specifications when indicated Assure that plant wide quality policies and instructions are maintained at Supplier Locations Assure inspection of product is conducted and data is analyzed Assure supplier Maintains Quality documents i.e. APQP documents, IATF certification and other applicable certification related to the tubing field including extrusions, coatings, fabrications and assembly components Support New Product Launches and Engineering changes Review and approve supplier PPAP using AIAG standards as well as Customer Specific Requirements Communicate to the supplier UACJ and its customers quality expectations and corrective/preventive actions Evaluate the effectiveness of supplier corrective/preventive actions Log and follow-up supplier quality complaints Work with Purchasing for all supplier scorecard input Have knowledge of various ASTM and customer specifications as well as ISO9001, BV, AS9100, NADCAP, Norsok and other certifications and procedures. Promote Safety as the Number One Priority of all HandyTube employees Performs other tasks as assigned Requirements Bachelors’ Degree in Metallurgical Engineering Metallurgist At least 3 to 5 years’ related experience. Mechanical aptitude and willingness to get dirty. Ability to utilize ERP system to analyze machine performance. Strong interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills with the ability to correspondence verbally and in writing in a manner which results in mutual understanding. Mentor and provide technical support to less experienced engineers at HandyTube Ability to work with limited direction, collaborate with other individuals and groups as appropriate to project and manage multiple concurrent tasks. Ability to lead process improvements using our HandyTube continuous improvement system, including the development and implementation of standard work. Ability to influence cross-functional business partners. Ability to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects and tools, reach with hands and arms, and regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Good close vision and depth perception skills. AutoCAD and SolidWorks experience preferred. Positive attitude, good judgment and excellent time management skills. Develop and inspect appraisal and prevention costs. General Responsibilities Communicate quality concerns to Operators, Supervisors, Engineers, or Management. Provide backup for other Quality Department areas, as Position Title: Plant Engineering Manager Department: Maintenance Reports to: Plant Manager Date: March 2023 ...Are you interested in the sweet life? ...Do you love chocolate?! ...Then we want to meet you! Founded in 1983, MARICH Confectionary Company is passionate about creating craveable ways to combine modern and fresh flavors with our proud European heritage. Run by a proud second-generation candy making family, our carefully crafted innovations come to life in our central coast California Chocolate Factory where we layer the most fun, flavorful, ethically sourced ingredients we can find with deliciously decadent chocolates. The result: A collection of snackable, sharable, and giftable everyday indulgence that you’re sure to enjoy…and feel good about! Come join our MARICH Family: where people are our main priority! We are committed to the happiness and success of our employees, customers, and suppliers. Without them, we wouldn’t have a chocolate company to care about. Position Summary: This position reports to the Plant Manager and is responsible for managing our Maintenance team and overseeing all day-to-day maintenance work requests are completed. Company Overview:Come and work with us the “TT Way” which means we do the right thing, bring out the best in each other, achieve more together, champion expertise and get the job done…well! Building the expertise of our people is critical to the future success of our organisation. TT Electronics is a global provider of engineered electronics. As a responsible employer we encourage all our people to “give something back” by supporting the local communities in which we operate. Our site in Perry, Ohio is part of the Global Manufacturing Solutions (GMS) business. Job purpose This role has responsibility over field instrumentation, electrical controls system design/documentation, I&C specifications/procurement, machine interface, control system programming, contractor/vendor administrative controls, and commissioning/start-up. The Senior Controls Engineer will oversee electrical contractors and control cabinet design and construction in addition to field wiring of instruments. This role requires periodic travel (10-15% travel), including potential international travel, during system installation and commissioning. functionality, troubleshooting, and upkeep of systems. · Development of SCADA systems, Network Topology, and VPN access controls · May have direct reports of junior engineers and/or electricians Job Title: Applied Machine Learning Scientist - Data Technologies
Job Description: Who we are: The Bloomberg Engineering Data Technologies Department engineers systems and models that serve billions of data points to some of the World's most discerning customers each day. The Data Science team is a dynamic, collaborative and intellectually stimulating bunch, working together on interesting problems to bring impact to our customers and clients. We care deeply about building a diverse, inclusive organization, and hope that you can join us in this exciting work!  What we do: At Bloomberg, our systems ingest hundreds of billions of market data ticks and millions of curated news stories for financial players to process and make investment decisions. Our company-wide machine learning efforts enhance our clients' ability to find the right pieces of information that are necessary to succeed in their jobs.  In our Data Science team, we are transforming the technology, the data and the insights that Bloomberg provides to our customers across the global financial sector, using data science and machine learning.  What's in it for you: You will work alongside extraordinary talent to find innovative solutions to some of the most interesting problems in the Financial Industry (and beyond!) using data science and machine learning. In collaboration with colleagues in Engineering, the CTO office, the Data group and the Product organization, you will be working with complex datasets, developing prototypes to test analytical hypotheses and performing statistical quantitative analyses to drive business value for the company.  You'll need to have: 4+ years of experience with an object-oriented programming language such as Python or Java Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Natural language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), Statistical Models, and Text Analytics on large data sets Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience Experience using Apache Spark or other distributed data processing technologies Ability to work with the Software Development Lifecycle (version control, unit testing, etc.) We'd like to see: Prior work with financial data in large-scale, data-rich environments Fluency in time series, panel data, behavioral analysis, text processing and/or alternative data and Bayesian statistics Experience with deep learning Sense of ownership of the work, working well both independently and collaboratively  Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. Description Job Description: The Leidos Innovation Center (LInC) at Leidos currently has an opening for an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Developer to work at our customer site on Wright-Patterson AFB, OH. We are seeking a dedicated, talented, and experienced AI Developer to work as part of a leading-edge research and engineering, design and development team. Leidos seeks mission and team-oriented individuals who enjoy working as an individual contributor in highly collaborative and interdisciplinary teams. The AI Developer will contribute to the Adaptive Technologies for Force Readiness Program supporting AFRL/RHW. The ATFR Program provides the Air Force with research into a wide range of advanced machine learning (ML) technologies-such as cognitive modeling, adversarial robustness, and reinforcement learning—with the goal of creating reliable autonomous agents capable of teaming up with Warfighters in dynamic mission environments. The Air Force is increasingly utilizing ML systems across a variety of domains to solve myriad problems. However, these systems are frequently susceptible to adversarial attacks, making them a potential security risk when deployed outside of laboratory conditions. The primary effort the AI developer will be contributing to is the development of novel metrics for measuring the robustness of ML systems. The secondary effort will be designing, then comparing ML systems trained interactively to independently trained counterparts. Primary Responsibilities You will work as part of a research team to develop creative and innovative solutions for complex machine learning and artificial intelligence problems. Collect, process, and analyze various types of data for researching and developing analytics tools and approaches. Research, then implement machine learning algorithms, techniques, and other tools from academic literature. Work along with full-stack developers to build UIs, data visualizations, and model performance charts for downstream use. Basic Qualifications Master’s degree or higher, or a bachelor’s degree with 2+ years' experience in Computer Science, Visual Analytics, Machine Learning, Mathematics or related field. Experience with Visual Analytics, Human-Computer Interactions, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning. Experience with conducting research in machine learning. Proficient with Python Proficient with PyTorch and Numpy. Proficient with git, Jira, and agile development Self-motivated with strong intellectual curiosity, especially around defining impact. Maintain outstanding written and oral communications skills, and good organizational skills. Be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously. Be a US Citizen and capable of obtaining DOD Secret security clearance. Preferred Qualifications Experience in full-stack development, web-based systems, service-oriented architectures, front-end user interfaces, and back-end databases. Experience with UI development. Experience with Adversarial Robustness. Experience with Active or Interactive Machine Learning. Experience with human subjects research, user studies, or UX design and testing. Experience in a research environment. Experience in Web Development Experience using High Performance Computing or Cloud Computing. Proficient with Node Frameworks (React or Angular) Cognitive modeling/ intelligent agent experience. Active DOD Secret security clearance. LInC Electronic Warfare Pay Range: Pay Range $63,050.00 - $97,000.00 - $130,950.00 The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law. To apply to this job, click Apply Now Show Less Report

Job Title: Senior Language Modeling Engineer - Artificial Intelligence Group
Job Description: Bloomberg is a global leader in business and financial information, delivering trusted data, news, and insights that bring transparency, efficiency, and fairness to markets. The Bloomberg Terminal connects influential communities across the global financial ecosystem via reliable technology that enables our customers to make informed decisions and foster collaboration.  For over a decade, Bloomberg has been a trailblazer in financial applications of AI, machine learning, and natural language processing (NLP). The Artificial Intelligence group is responsible for driving adoption of these technologies at Bloomberg, with over 250 research engineers working collaboratively to provide clients with the best-in-class news, research, market data, and analytics.  The AI group contributes to Bloomberg's flagship products such as news, research, pricing, communications platforms, search and discovery tools. We work on a variety of AI subfields, including NLP, information retrieval, time series analysis, and recommender systems. Textual data is particularly key to understanding how events in the world impact our clients. Whether it's analyzing social media sentiment over thousands of tweets per second, automatically extracting key indicators from press releases and filings, or helping clients derive intelligence from their internal communications by identifying entities and intents, we've used NLP to help Bloomberg maintain its edge as the market leader in financial data and communications.  The advent of large language models (LLMs) presents new opportunities for expanding our NLP capabilities in our products. BloombergGPT - our recently announced large language model - is the most performant language model for financial text, and it puts us at the forefront of building innovative NLP products for our clients.  As a Language Modeling Engineer, you will have access to BloombergGPT and other LLMs, as well as vast amounts of high-quality data that go into training and evaluating them. You will be expected to lead the way in applying these models to transform our current approaches and creating groundbreaking new products that would have been impossible with the previous generation of technologies. You will also be responsible for developing the next generation of LLMs for state-of-the-art financial NLP.  We'll trust you to: Collaborate with teams across the company on the application of LLMs to core product Optimize the way we train, tune and serve LLMs Stay current with the latest research in NLP and AI regarding LLMs and incorporate new findings into our models and methodologies Monitor the performance of deployed LLMs and continuously develop them based on user feedback You'll need to have: A Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience. Relevant work experience (5+ years after Masters or 2+ years after Ph.D.) An understanding of Computer Science fundamentals such as data structures and algorithms. If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch with you to let you kno w what the next steps are. In the meantime, check us out at http://www.techatbloomberg.com/ai.  Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.  Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Job Title: Senior NLP Research Engineer - Artificial Intelligence Group
Job Description: The AI Group is the central engineering group responsible for driving Machine Learning (ML) adoption at Bloomberg, with over 200 researchers and engineers working together to provide clients with the best-in-class news, research, market data, and analytics using innovative machine learning technology. We directly impact a wide variety of our flagship products, including news, research, pricing, communications platforms, search and discovery tools. We work on a variety of ML fields, including natural language processing, information retrieval, time series analysis, and recommender systems.  Some projects where we are looking for experienced research engineers include: unified search, question answering, query parsing, financial instrument (e.g., fixed income) pricing, dialogue understanding. Our research engineers are responsible for architecting and implementing models end-to-end, overcoming unique challenges that come with machine learning systems in the financial domain. In addition, we contribute to open source; contributions we have made and work with include Solr, Koan, KFServing, Cloud Native Buildpacks and PyTorch Lightning that directly impact our production services.  Textual data is key to understanding how events in the world impact our clients. As the amount of unstructured data has increased, natural language processing has become a key tool for Bloomberg to deliver analytics faster, more accurately, and at a larger scale than ever before. Whether it's analyzing the social media sentiment of companies over thousands of tweets per second, automatically extracting key indicators from press releases and filings before the rest of the market, or helping our clients derive intelligence from their internal communications by identifying entities and intents, NLP has enabled Bloomberg to maintain its edge as the market leader in financial data and communications.  We'll trust you to: Collaborate with colleagues on production systems and applications Design, experiment, and evaluate algorithms as well as models Write, test, and maintain production-quality code Represent Bloomberg at scientific and industry conferences Publish research findings in leading academic venues You'll need to have: Masters or a Ph.D. in CS, ML, Math, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Quant, or related fields. Relevant work experience (5+ years after Masters or 2+ years after Ph.D.) Proficiency in software development If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch with you to let you kno w what the next steps are. In the meantime, check us out at http://www.techatbloomberg.com/ (http://www.techatbloomberg.com/)  Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. Fora Financial is a technology enabled, leading provider of flexible financing to small and medium sized businesses. Since our inception in 2008, we have supported more than 25,000 merchants nationwide with over $2 billion of capital used for a variety of purposes, from funding everyday operating expenses to managing cash flow gaps to facilitating business expansion, and much more. Leveraging our proprietary technology, Fora Financial is able to deliver capital to our customers via a streamlined and simple process that can be completed in as little as 24 hours, compared with the weeks or even months it often takes for a business to receive a bank loan. Over the past fourteen years, Fora Financial has grown from two founders in a small Manhattan workspace to a company of nearly 200 employees with new offices in New York and Miami. Fora Financial prides itself on being a partner-centric organization, offering a customized funding approach, collaborating with our small-business customers to understand their needs in a dynamic and ever-changing economic environment. The Senior Data Analyst – Marketing is responsible for leading and conducting key Marketing analyses that will yield demonstrable impact for Fora Financial. internal and external data sets to provide insights for Marketing initiatives. Responsible for the development, testing, and implementation of multiple Marketing reports and dashboards using Tableau and other reporting tools. Create and maintain detailed campaign tracking of Marketing programs and provide insights and recommendations. In collaboration with Marketing, use internal/external data sources and models to identify prospects for Fora’s direct mail program and provided technical and analytical support to execute the mailer campaigns. Identify and/or implement opportunities for improvements to current Marketing process workflows. Serve as the liaison between Marketing, IT, and Analytics to ensure flawless execution of Marketing strategies. Provide other ad hoc analytics/reports as requested by management.  Requirements: B.S. degree or higher in Data Science, Computer Science, or equivalent quantitative field 5+ years of experience in Marketing analytics Experience working with cloud-based data technologies such as Snowflake or similar Proven ability to aggregate, extract, validate, and analyze large datasets using complex SQL queries Hands-on experience building and publishing customized and interactive dashboards within Tableau Advanced level of MS Excel skills, including advanced formulas, VBA, macros and data tables In depth understanding of data collection, data flow management, data manipulation, data archiving and data standards Passionate about solving problems with data and high level of intellectual curiosity Highly motivated to work on multiple projects in parallel and team player with a startup spirit Very strong written and oral communication skills, with proven ability to translate complex analysis into actionable insights to a non-technical audience  The Benefits of Working for Fora Financial: Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage 401K Match Life Insurance at No Cost to Employees Generous Job Title: Senior Data Scientist / Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning / AI/ML Scientist
Job Description: Advance your career and our mission As a Senior Data Scientist / Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning / AI/ML Scientist, you will work with a highly innovative and vibrant team of Data Scientists in developing the next generation AI/ML enabled Financial Advice solutions for Vanguard. You will apply your analytics, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and cloud technologies knowledge to create foundations for the next generation of smart and cloud connected platform and services. This work will transform how financial advice is made accessible to the masses. With great freedom to innovate, you will play a leading role in world-class research that will drive the future of Vanguard’s artificial intelligence and machine learning. You will make a difference by leading and innovating new AI based systems and services that power our financial advice business. You will team up with business stakeholders to prioritize innovation ideas and work with other data scientists to develop and deliver breakthrough solutions. In addition, you will coach, mentor, and guide junior data scientists to help them excel and advance their career development. In this role you will You will be working with a dynamic team of Innovators, AI engineers and data scientists that are at the forefront of AI/ML application for the company. You will be working at our Malvern Campus, focusing on researching and developing leading-edge analytics enabled solutions for our AI based financial Advice platform; including applying smart algorithms, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and cloud technologies. The team works closely with subject matter experts in investment methodology and economic theory. Vanguard has been changing the way the world invests for over 40 years, as a company we’re committed to improving the lives of our clients. We’re using AI and ML to create experiences and services that will help more people than ever reach their goals. As an Advice Principal Data Scientist you’ll be responsible for helping trail blaze AI/ML at Vanguard – some of the most important work we’ve ever done as a company. Your Challenge: You will be challenged to be influential and make a positive difference on a global scale, working on a team that is purely focused on AI/ML Research. Strong communication skills are essential to deliver your message globally across various stakeholders/teams with diverse backgrounds and focus areas spanning research, development, engineering, business, and management. You will be working in a very agile, dynamic environment leading/supporting ongoing activities while starting new ones. Therefore, success in this role requires excellent multitasking and time management skills. We look to you to surprise us in building breakthrough AI-enabled systems leveraging modern AI techniques to create value from the data collected and generated by our base systems. These AI enabled systems and services will allow us to provide highly individualized advice at a massive scale. You will apply your advanced data analytics, artificial intelligence/machine learning knowledge and experience to interact with stakeholders, identify new problems and opportunities, develop innovative propositions, contribute to intellectual property, and build and pilot first-of-its-kind demonstrators. You will play a strong role in shaping our agenda. What it takes PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Electrical Engineering or related field, with 2+ years of experience in developing and implementing AI/ML related projects Strong technical skills on machine learning/AI with proven track record. These technical skills include, but not limited to, regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, probability theory, stochastic systems, Bayesian inference, statistical techniques, deep learning, supervised learning, unsupervised learning Strong technical knowledge on big data technologies, cloud, and opensource software tools Outstanding track record of successful solutions design in the digital space Experienced in using AI/ML platforms, technologies, techniques (e.g. TensorFlow, Apache MXnet, Theano, Keras, CNTK, scikit-learn, H2O, Spark MLlib, etc). Proficiency with SQL and NoSQL databases Proficiency with scalable data extraction tools (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB) Proficiency with Scala, Spark, Java and/or SAS Special Factor Work must be performed in the U.S. About Vanguard We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests. For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you. We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count. Inclusion Statement Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.” We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values. When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose. Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success. Future of Work During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely. As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew. When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers). The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way. Salary Range: $100,000.00 - $180,000.00 Apply Now: click Apply Now Show Less Report

Job Description General Summary: The Principal Statistical Programming Standards coordinates the standards-related activities of Statistical Programming staff projects. The Principal Statistical Programmer works with management to delegate tasks appropriately, track progress, and provide expert technical support to team members Key Duties and Responsibilities: Provides technical leadership to review and approve documentation required to support data analysis, reporting, and CDlSC data submission compliant with FDA/ICH/GCP regulations. Demonstrates expert knowledge of clinical development and medical data. Engages in dialogue with persons in Senior Management and in a variety of other functions, especially Statistical Programmers, Biostatisticians, Data Management, and other departments engaged in providing data for CDISC packages. Provides leadership to ensure compliance with Vertex SOP'S and FDA/ICH/GCP regulations Required Skills/Knowledge Proficient in all SAS language, procedures, and options commonly used in clinical trial reporting including the Macro language, BASE SAS, SAS/STAT and SAS/GRAPH. Programming experience in R . Understanding Perl regular expressions in SAS, debugging, and writing macros in VBA Understanding of working with MDR (Meta Data Repository) and SCE (Statistical Computing Environment) Thorough understanding of data submission requirements and creation of eSUB packages for multiple regulatory agencies (For eg: FDA, EMA, PMDA, etc.). Thorough understanding of the implementation of CDISC, CDASH, and regulatory standards on different data types. Education and Experience: Bachelors degree in a Scientific Discipline Typically requires 5+ for M.S. or above and 8+ years for B.S. years of work experience in Biotech, Pharmaceuticals or Clinical Research Organization Pay Range: 136,960.00 - 205,440.00 The range provided is based on what we believe is a reasonable estimate for the base salary pay range for this job at the time of posting.
